title: Missing optimization with signed pointer offset

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: I-slow
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to performance of generated code.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I am trying to elide the pointer offset of a slice indexing operation. 

I tried this code:

```rust
pub fn index(table: &[u128; 4], idx: i32) -> u128 {
    table[(idx as usize & 0b11_0000) >> 4]
}
```
with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full RUSTFLAGS='--emit=asm' cargo build --release`.

I expected to see this happen: 
```asm
example::index:
  and esi, 48
  mov rax, qword ptr [rsi + rdi]
  mov rdx, qword ptr [rsi + rdi + 8]
  ret
```
(selects two bits, already in the pointer offset position)

Instead, this happened: 
```asm
example::index:
  shr esi, 4
  and esi, 3
  shl rsi, 4
  mov rax, qword ptr [rdi + rsi]
  mov rdx, qword ptr [rdi + rsi + 8]
  ret
```

A godbolt link for comparison with an unsafe version which does apply the optimization: https://godbolt.org/z/0QsA3z
